New Records: Reynaldo López pitched six strong innings with only two singles allowed, lowering his season ERA to 2.00
Key Match Events: Travis d'Arnaud hit a walk-off home run in the ninth inning to give the Braves a 2-1 win over the Royals
The Braves tied the game in the fourth with an unearned run after a double by Jorge Soler and an error by the Royals' pitcher
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves' magic number is one to clinch their seventh straight playoff appearance
The Braves have a makeup doubleheader set for Monday against the Mets after two games were washed out by Hurricane Helene
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker said the win was 'big' and 'playoff baseball, literally'
Travis d'Arnaud said the win was 'great' and credited the Braves' pitchers for keeping them in the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals clinched their first postseason appearance since 2015 and went with a makeshift lineup
Bobby Witt Jr. sat out for the first time all season and likely locked up the AL batting title with a.332 average
Others: Reynaldo López returned from the injured list and pitched six strong innings
Raisel Iglesias earned the win with a perfect top half of the ninth
The Braves moved one game ahead of the New York Mets and Arizona Diamondbacks in the race for the final two NL wild-card spots
